CoreFeatureImplementation.justification: The agent did not implement any of the required features as no source code was provided.

UserInteractionAndExperience.justification: No user interaction was implemented because no code was generated.

AssetAndSceneManagement.justification: The project fails to manage assets and scenes as there is no code to do so.

ValidProjectStructure.justification: The project is missing all source code files.

GradleConfiguration.justification: The Gradle configuration uses incorrect dependencies and outdated manual task registrations.

ManifestConfiguration.justification: A manifest file is present but it is incomplete without an activity.

CodeSyntax.justification: There are no source code files to evaluate for syntax.

ImportResolution.justification: There are no import statements to evaluate.

CorrectApiUsage.justification: The agent did not use the Meta Spatial SDK at all.

IdiomaticSdkPatterns.justification: No SDK patterns were used as no code was written.

ResourceManagement.justification: There is no evidence of resource management.

AdherenceToConventions.justification: There is no code to evaluate for adherence to conventions.

CodeReadabilityAndStructure.justification: The project lacks any code structure or readability.

CodeModularityAndReusability.justification: The project has no modularity or reusability.

NullSafetyAndErrorHandling.justification: There is no null safety or error handling implemented.

CoreFeatureImplementation.justification: The implementation is partial and appears non-functional due to incorrect API usage.

UserInteractionAndExperience.justification: The code includes a UI for interaction, but it is minimal and likely does not work.

AssetAndSceneManagement.justification: Asset loading is implemented with placeholders and relies on incorrect SDK APIs.

ValidProjectStructure.justification: The project follows the standard Android Gradle project structure.

GradleConfiguration.justification: Gradle files use incorrect monolithic dependencies and plugin configurations.

ManifestConfiguration.justification: The Android manifest correctly declares the main activity.

CodeSyntax.justification: The code is mostly free of syntax errors but uses outdated APIs.

ImportResolution.justification: Imports are inconsistent with the correct modular SDK dependencies.

CorrectApiUsage.justification: The agent uses what appears to be an older, incorrect version of the SDK API.

IdiomaticSdkPatterns.justification: The project does not follow the recommended patterns for the current SDK version.

ResourceManagement.justification: There is minimal evidence of proper resource management.

AdherenceToConventions.justification: The code generally adheres to Kotlin and Android coding conventions.

CodeReadabilityAndStructure.justification: The code is structured into classes and functions but is overly simplistic.

CodeModularityAndReusability.justification: The code shows some modularity but has limited reusability.

NullSafetyAndErrorHandling.justification: Null safety is present but error handling is completely absent.
